results.definition: take the place of or be parallel or equivalent to
examples: Because of the sound changes in the course of history, an 'h' in Greek stands for an 's' in Latin

results.definition: express indirectly by an image, form, or model; be a symbol
examples: What does the Statue of Liberty symbolize?
This period is represented by Beethoven

results.definition: be a delegate or spokesperson for; represent somebody's interest or be a proxy or substitute for, as of politicians and office holders representing their constituents, or of a tenant representing other tenants in a housing dispute
examples: I represent the silent majority

results.definition: serve as a means of expressing something
examples: The flower represents a young girl
This compositional style is exemplified by this fugue
This money is my only income
The stone wall was the backdrop for the performance
These constitute my entire belonging
The children made up the chorus
This sum represents my entire income for a year
These few men comprise his entire army

results.definition: be the defense counsel for someone in a trial
examples: Ms. Smith will represent the defendant

results.definition: create an image or likeness of
examples: The painter represented his wife as a young girl
Gielgud played Hamlet
She wants to act Lady Macbeth, but she is too young for the role
She played the servant to her husband's master

results.definition: perform (a play), especially on a stage
examples: we are going to stage `Othello'

results.definition: describe or present, usually with respect to a particular quality
examples: He represented this book as an example of the Russian 19th century novel

results.definition: point out or draw attention to in protest or remonstrance
examples: our parents represented to us the need for more caution

results.definition: bring forward and present to the mind
examples: We presented the arguments to him
We cannot represent this knowledge to our formal reason

results.definition: to establish a mapping (of mathematical elements or sets)
